title: Yorkshire Ripper Peter Sutcliffe 'skips four-month NHS waiting list' for eye operation to improve his sight

Yorkshire Ripper Peter Sutcliffe has reportedly skipped lengthy NHS waiting lists to undergo eye surgery. 
The murderer was moved to HMP Frankland last year as it was declared he no longer needed treatment for mental disorders after spending three decades on a psychiatric ward at Broadmoor Hospital . 
Now Sutcliffe has had an operation to improve his eyesight after bypassing lengthy NHS queues for treatment. 
The 70-year-old was chained to five guards when taken 14 miles from HMP Frankland to Sunderland Eye Infirmary at the end of last month. 
At the infirmary, he is said to have had cataract surgery, despite some people waiting 15 months on NHS waiting lists for the same procedure, the Sun reports. 
Figures show the average waiting time for the procedure for patients in Sunderland is around 13 weeks. 
In December, eye specialists visited the murderer in jail to check on his eyesight. He was left blind in one eye after an attack in Broadmoor in 1997. Read More Charles Bronson lends support to Bradley Lowery and tells brave cancer battler "We all love's ya!" Sutcliffe seriously injured his eye during a fight in prison (Photo: Mirrorpix) 
The cataract op takes up to 45 minutes and involves removing the eye’s blurred lens and replacing it with an artificial one. 
Sutcliffe left wearing an eye patch. 
His victims’ families have been left furious at his treatment and Neil Jackson, whose mum Emily, 42, was Sutcliffe’s second victim in 1976, told the newspaper: “It’s a disgrace. They should let him go blind.” 
Evil Sutcliffe is set to spend the remainder of his life in high-security Frankland after being moved from Broadmoor psychiatric hospital. The infamous killer was given 20 life sentences in 1981 after admitting murdering 13 women and attempting to kill seven more. 
His final victim, Jacqueline Hill, a 20-year-old student from Middlesbrough, was found battered to death on November 17, 1980, on waste ground in Leeds.
